I've played this a lot on both PC and Xbox 360 and I really want to add, despite the poor qualities this game has, It's incredibly enjoyable from both a gameplay and storytelling standpoint. If you enjoy western RPGs, increasing numbers and ragdoll effects, you really can't go wrong with this game.

Just remember to look up and download the Two Worlds Control Panel for both mods and controller support (it's made by a beta tester and on the Nexus if you're scared about harmful files)

this game is very very good, a lot of people call it a 'elder scrolls clone' or a 'poor man's oblivon' but its really really not. for starters you can join the enemy faction where in oblivion you can't join the nerocmancers or the blackwood company or the bandits but in this game you can, you can join the karga clan or the neromancers. number two, your mc has a lot of character hes sassy at times and I love his reactions to the world and its problems. Also on the 'bad voices' note, yes cause Oblivon had the best voices ever. Yes cause the redguard was the most inspiring voice ever that monotone 'don't feel bad no one lives forever' as a matter of fact, the only two good voices were the impeiral and the elves the rest sucked. and it feels like two worlds map is way way better and there is so much more to do in it I love this game so much. I can't recomend this game any more then i do right now

Tuto hru znám už strašně dlouho, prakticky od doby, kdy byla vydána ještě v krabicové podobě. Je výborná, a milovníku RPG her ji vřele doporučuji. Sám jsem ji obehrál už snad desetkrát ne-li vícekrát.
 Systém vylepšování zbroje, a vybavení, se poněkud liší od toho klasického na který je většina pařmenů RPGček zvyklá, což ovšem nijak nenarušuje hratelnost, a zážitek ze hry, spíše naopak. Možná se bude zdát někomu zvláštní, ale pochopí jej hned, a časem si ho s velkou pravděpodobností i oblíbí. Ze začátku je hra trochu obtížnější, i na nejnižší obtížnost, což ovšem bohatě vyváží zážitek ze zbytku hry, i skutečnost, že zde prakticky nemůžete zemřít v pravém slova smyslu. Jakmile se tedy dostanete přes úvodní zhruba hodinku hry, jste král, celý otevřený, fantasticky barevný svět vám leží u nohou, příběh hlavní dějové linie, jakož i nepřeberné množství postranních úkolů (které se nikdy neopakují) se dá řešit mnoha rozličnými způsoby, a až herní mechanismus dostatečně pochopíte, možná ho budete mít raději než ten klasicky.
Třešničkou na dortu je pak velmi kvalitně provedená lokalizace do češtiny formou titulků které jsou právě tak velké aby byly dobře čitelné, přitom nerušily ve vnímání děje, a velmi zdařile vyvedené co do srozumitelnosti obsahu.
Two Words je prostě sice starší, ale naprosto fantastická gameska, ke které jsem si odskočil od Grim Dawnu, a za peníze které za ni na Steamu chtějí rozhodně stojí.
Macht spaß aber online Stürtzt immer mein Spiel ab und es ist auch leider keiner der spielt.
this game is rubbish the online doesn't work right

Two Worlds é um jogo para que realmente curte um RPG de mundo aberto, bem semelhante aos jogos da franquia The Elder Scrolls, em um vasto mapa com inúmeras missões e inimigos formidáveis. Por ser um jogo antigo e possuir gráficos modestos, mesmo comparando com jogos da época, porém possui cenários muito bem feitos e uma ambientação excelente. Podemos encontrar masmorras repletas de mortos-vivos, castelos, bosques, montanhas, variedade de climas e vegetações, rios, desertos, lugares habitados por demônios e até mesmo dragões. 
Assim como todo bom RPG é possível interagir com diversas facções, que muitas vezes não se dão bem umas com as outras, então deve-se escolher cuidadosamente em que lado você vai querer estar. A trilha sonora é muito bem feita e imersiva, talvez seja um dos maiores pontos fortes do jogo. Outro ponto forte é que dar para trilhar seu próprio caminho, você pode ser um valente herói ou um impiedoso vilão, algumas missões podem influenciar diretamente no caminho do seu personagem e até mesmo podem mudar o final do jogo. 
O jogo possui muitas variedades de equipamentos como armas, armaduras, túnicas, escudos e etc. O interessante é não existe um sistema de classes dentro do jogo, assim possibilitando que cada um possa contruir seu personagem de maneira única. Para quem gosta de jogar de mago o  jogo conta com uma respeitável quantidade de magias para as mais diversas situações em uma batalha como buffs que podem aumentar absurdamente seu dano mágico, magias destrutivas em alvos individuais ou em grupo, magias de paralisia, magias de cura e tantas outras opções. Para os arqueiros contam com diversas habilidades vão desde flechas atordoantes a flechas múltiplas para grupos de inimigos. Os guerreiros podem manipular uma grande quantidade de armas, que são bem variadas e cada uma exige sua respectiva perícia para ser usada de forma eficiente, dessa forma podemos dizer que é um estilo bem versátil e equilibrado. Também há perícias para furtividade, ladrão, armadilhas, alquimia e tantas outras opções.
Infelizmente o jogo tem um sistema de combate que as vezes é confuso, pois dependendo da arma que será utilizada a luta pode ser simples ou um verdadeiro inferno. A perícia assassinato não é tão eficiente quanto deveria. Jogar de arco no início é uma tarefa que exige paciência, e muita, porém em níveis altos seu personagem pode ser muito forte. O sistema de customização é muito limitado e pobre. Outro ponto negativo é que não dar para jogar com personagem feminino. A única tradução para este jogo é uma não-oficial, feita as pressas por um fã (serei eternamente grato mesmo assim :D). O cavalo é extremamente limitado com relação a mobilidade mais pode servir como inventário extra, pois ajuda bastante na hora de juntar umas tralhas para vender na cidade.
Apesar dos problemas, Two Worlds é um jogo que recomendo bastante aqueles que curtem jogos de RPG que te dão liberdade de exploração em um vasto mundo com a possibilidade se escolha entre o bem ou o mal em uma longa e épica jornada. É uma boa opção de jogo para se comprar em uma promoção.

Despite every issue with the game: bugs, voice acting, bad optimization, crappy storyline and everything else, I find myself enjoying it so far. It's even got a freaking 300 (almost 400) pages manual, that looks like it took more effort to make than the game itself. The combat system feels really really weird and difficult (you will die a lot) at first but after a couple hours you start to grasp how everything works and it becomes actually pretty fun. The alchemy and magic system are easy to learn, useful and necessary depending on the kind of foe you're going against. There's not much else to tell, just don't expect an Elder Scrolls/The Witcher/Divinity in terms of story cause you WILL be disappointed. Also the multiplayer is pretty much dead. 

"TL;DR": 
It's a fun game and I don't think it deserves all the bash it gets

Tamam çok ümitliydim bu oyundan, ama sanki 2009'da değil de 1999'da çıksaymış yine harikulade denilebilirmiş. Fikir şahane, farklı türden bir oynanış sunan RPG ama optimizasyon sifir, sifir, sifir... Intro falan olmadan, güm diye oyuna başlayışı da zaten beni benden aldı. 2001 yapımı Severance - Blade of Darkness bile daha iyi şu oyundan.

Fakat Two Worlds 2 için aynı şeyi söyleyemem, hatalarını büyük ölçüde gidermişler ve daha keyifle oynanabilir bir oyun çıkarmışlar ortaya. Ha yine de 2017 için çok eski kalan bir oyun gibi ama olsun, alınan RP hazzı fena değil.

Sorry for the Hate but I never understood how this game could have become so successful.

Well yes, I was hyped when Two Worlds was released. It looks pretty interesting.

But everything you do, running, fighting, talking is mediocre at maximum even compared with other games from its time.
The graphics are not very good especially the animations are pretty bad. It also is laggy.

Oh and the voice acting sounds awful.

However, sometimes this game has a good looking scenery and I like how you improve weapons in Two Worlds.

I would recommend not to buy this. There are plenty RPGs which are far better (and I'm not talking about Two Worlds II !)

Game of my childhood, i remember when it first came out it was bugged as hell, well i couldnt recommend you back then, but now it changed a lot. Back then i was crazy about third person rpg games.Oblivion came out in 2006 then Gothic 3 in late 2006 a few months later this and then Witcher in 2007, man those where the times.
Its a simple rpg you are free to explore the world go wherever you want and collect a lot of junks. At first its hard as you struggle with simple wolves, then you build some muscle and bash the bigger enemies, then you become a super powerfull immortal god who kill everything in the blink of an eye which kills the fun after a while but this is how the game works.
Good game

This game could have been fun but it just has so many problems that drag it down. First, the inventory is so small you literally have to teleport back to town to sell your loot every 10 minutes if you don't spec as a warrior. Also, the world is empty and your character is very slow. All the npcs and quest givers talk way too much and never say anything interesting they just go on and on and on... The magic is nowhere near as fun as the second game. You can only have three spells equipped at a time which is pitiful and enemies NEVER drop spells for you to learn and the merchants NEVER have good spells to sell. I'm 13 hours in playing as a full mage and I've been stuck with the Fireball spell almost the WHOLE TIME because it's the ONLY spell that enemies drop! So yeah this game is just below mediocre and honestly the second game is way better than this one...

Fun game with an interesting world, but it crashes ALOT. Lmao i don't even have a shitty pc and it crashes 2-3 times in a 4 window. But i still put up with the sadness of crashes, if you get it save OFTEN.

J'ai joué à ce jeu il y a longtemps. Crée par un studio amateur et pas cher du tout. A l'époque ou j'avais presque jamais d'argent. J'était sur windows 7 car le jeu ne marche pas sur windows 9 et 10.
Le jeu est un rpg open world assez grand et assez dure. Je ne me souviens pas bcp de ce jeu mais je vais vous racconter ce que je sais. 
Je me souviens pas de l'histoire mais je sais qu'elle était bien mieux que celle insignifiante de Skyrim. Meme si elle reste bien classique avec un duel classique entre le mal et le bien. 
Il y a bcp de villes et les vendeurs sont nombreux et les armes et potions ne sont pas trop chers. 
On peut apprendre de nouvelles competence avec les pnj dès le début du jeu. Je vous conseille d'apprendre peau de pierre avec le sorcier du village de déart. C'est hyper utile pour la suite du jeu qui est dur. 
On trouve je crois la possibilité d etre un bersecker, un guerrier ou un mage. Mais j'ai fait qu'une seule partie et je n'ai essayé que le guerrier. 
Ils ont eus cette idée géniale et pétée de pouvoir fusionner les armes iddentiques les unes aux autres dix fois en augmantant chaque fois les degats de 20%. 

Points négatifs. Car il y an a. 
Le jeu est plein de zones faciles qui comprennent des endroits plein de démons et de gros mobs et la difficulté y est presque décuplée. 
A la fin du jeu on ne comprend pas vraiment ce qu'il faut faire. Car l'orrientation et l'objectif final n'est pas du tout clair. 
Vers le nord de la carte il y a une zone avec le cité des méchants si on peut dire, qui est pleine de gros mobs quasiment impossible à battre meme avec un build et us stuff pété! J'en ai battu aucun. Et il faut les tuer pour finir le jeu alors j'ai arrété! 

Mais pour le prix je vous recommande ce jeu!! Il vaut larrgement plus que ça!

Plot is a train wreck, moving the character is like eating sand, and the menus are made of construction paper glued to your screen. Could not recommend Two Worlds more. It has so much diversity in environments and enemies; there is so much gosh darn content in this game, it's insane. If you get used to piloting this 1892 model car, combat is not impossible. There are insane amounts of weapons, spells, and armors. This game is very crude, poorly programmed, and archaic to say the least; but man is this game worth the same amount of time as Oblivion, it has more content and is a fresh experience of stereotypical rpg tropes.
Town Murder, Robbery, and Resurrection Simulator 2009. Just finish every quest first.

I like the magic in this game and exploring around the world can be fun, the story might be a good story but due to how bad the voice acting is, i rarely pay attention to it. Summoning in monsters though can be very fun. Due to how many you can summon in at once and the variety of monsters you can summon to help you out. That's about it though.

When I think about some of the worst games I've ever played, this is one of the first that springs to mind. I'll never understand why some people consider this piece of garbage to be a "hidden gem". I can't think of anything good to say about it. The combat is poor, the facial animations are the stuff of nightmares, the dialogue is on the same level as The Rooms, and the voice acting is some of the worst I've ever heard ever. The fact that the developers had enough fan approval to make a sequel to this "game" makes me lose faith in the human race.  

10/10 - Would play again.

This game has a great magic system and a great upgrading weapons mechanic by stacking similar weapons on each other. It can be a bit quirky at times but I if you let that go it can be a fun game to just mess around with.

[h1]Мда...[/h1]

Ну, начнем с того, что я познакомился в первый раз с этой игрой...точнее, с ее второй частью, ну, она мне показалась интересной, много заданий. Но всегда раздражали игры ММО РПГ составляющей. Единственное ММО РПГ в которое я залипал, это было PW. Ну, ладно еще был Neverwinter и Реквием [spoiler](кстати реквием притягивает атмосферой и своей оригинальностью, хоть и стара как моя жизнь, а все же до сих тепло к ней отношусь)[/spoiler], но оно очень быстро приедалось и надоедало.  Что собственно с этой игрой? Да, старая, да кривая как не знаю что, напомнила мне Oblivion, который так же меня не впечатлил своей ватностью. Вот самое интересное, Готика сразу мне понравилась, Морра и Обла которые вышли примерно в то же самое время - раздражали до жути. Видимо дело вкуса. Так вот, здесь я ощутил некое дежавю с Облой и Моррой. Ну, думаю, ладно, может дальше будет получше. В общем...нет. Лучше не стало. Терпение мое закончилось на моменте, когда я пришел к нужной локации, но не с той стороны, провалился в какой то баг, там ямка такая была из которой, разумеется, я не выбрался. И меня загрыз гризли. Потому что лук не наносил ему урона, а фаэр боллы летели в землю, потому что наш герой даун и не может поднять руку чуть выше. В общем не советую. Попробую поиграть во вторую еще часть, вспомнить свое первое знакомство, но что-то мне подсказывает, что...ай, ладно посмотрим, может быть  со второй все более менее будет. Но это...просто...что-то с чем-то.

Обзор написал Hilbert Schwarz

Where to begin with this game?  It was okay for a quick little game.  I would suggest just putting it on Easy and just blasting thru the game quickly.  Combat is very easy and it is so easy to overpower the enemies so early in the game.  If you were going to play I would suggest looking up a guide for almost every aspect of the game due to a lack of tutorial on any part of the game.  There were things I didn't discover until I was at the very end of the game because it was never explained.  I had to look up so many quests online because there weren't any quest markers or any way of telling where to go.  It's rare for me to rush thru a game and feel better after I'm finished with it.  I usually prefer to explore everything and do all the quests I can but after so many hours I was just ready for it to be over with.

Best voice acting award goes to this game. I played it originally on the Xbox360 and got it on here as soon as I found out it was on steam. This game is a hoot. Cracks me up and is actually pretty fun becoming extremely powerful and ruining cities and towns.

As an introductory note, I owned this on disc for years and still purchased the Steam edition.
On the plus side, this game is a true open world.  Aside from some locked locations that are integral to a quest you can go anywhere you please.  This means you can get into a lethal situation without warning.  Also, you genuinely start weak which means you can and probably should just run away and come back later.  Combat mechanics are surprisingly good for a game that was cheaply produced when consoles were the cutting edge of gaming; spears are useful as spears (with both reach and a nifty sweep attack), torches are usable in combat as well as being actually necessary in the dark, and different weapons work better on different opponents.  Using a horse is actually worthwhile, though mounted combat is a non-starter.  The side quests are frequently better written than your typical go-there-and-fetch-that sort of side quest.

Magic effects are fairly cinematic, with each elemental school looking quite distinct.

Graphic quality is low, but the landscape design is well done and in several locations creates a quite creepy atmosphere.  In one location, it actually game me vertigo even on a cruddy old VGA monitor.

On the minus side, the main quest is commonplace though in fairness this game is old enough that when written it hadn't all been done before.  Character art, particulary NPCs, is horrendous, awful, just plain bad.  The voice acting is at best uneven, but I feel like the main character's voice and dialog has gotten an overly harsh reputation.  Potions are useful, but the crafting system is both limited and unintuitive.  There is no armor/weapons crafting, but both may be improved through stacking (up to 50 identical items may be combined into one extra-strong version of itself).

Unlike some obsolete games, I still enjoy taking this one for a spin.
I am really happy with this game. i used to play this as a kid with my friends and its just as fun as i remember it. Though it is a very unstable game. I still enjoy it.

Ну что я могу сказать.Ну, скажем так, я купил данную игру т.к. это игра детства: на дядином пк играл и с каждого монстра дох и обсирался дико. Я в рпг ранее не играл и более хороших вариантов рпг`шек не пробовал толком так что для меня это конечно топ игра.Могу сказать что есть и получше рпг`шки это факт. Первые локации сделаны здорово, первые квесты тоже зашли, но чем дальше игру проходишь, тем больше тупости наблюдаешь. И не то, что гриндить нужно много, а большие расстояния приодолевать, притом пустые. Кароче середина игры отвратная из-за больших расстояний и неинтересных квестов. Одним из главных минусов игры я для себя выделил то, что на глобальной карте игроку предоставлены закрытые локации(отмечены деревни, города, чётко выделены дороги), но проблема в том, что если в первой части карты, которая исследуется нами в начале игры всего много: различные деревни, лагеря рахных монстров, дороги, развилки и т.к., то далее по нашему прохождению мы начинаем скучать, путешествуя по карте, т.к. далее на карте пропадают дороги, пропадают некоторые локации с карты. Да, возможно, что там типо неисследованные людьми локации, а потому ищи сам свои дороги и данжи, но всё же уже тепряется азарт к исследованию т.к. карта большая, а самые интересные локации находятся в какой-то жопе и чтобы их найти нужно следовать далеко не по дорогам, а проходить огромные пространства не имея ориентиров. Что касательно сюжета, то тут всё странно. В игре присутствует 1 главный квест, а остальные вы набираете сами. По сути получается, что самые интересные и незамысловатые квести только в начале и в конце игры т.к. они идут по сюжету. Прочие квесты от различных жителей деревень просто показались мне неинтересными т.к. там только что и есть: "пойди убей огра","уничтожь лагерь кого-нибудь","принеси мне предмет, ради которого спустись в данж и опять же перебей всех","убей того-то в городе","принеси мне N количество каких-либо предметов". Зачастую объект квеста либо находиться неподалёку, и проходиться он за 5 минут максимум, либо за час простой ходьбы, и проходиться только из-за расстояния за 2 часа реального времени, но по сложности всё очень просто всегда. Советую проходить игру на сложности: сложно, т.к. на любой другой вы станете максимально сильным за 6-8 часов игры( игру я прошел за 22 часа на средней сложности, пропустив некоторые локации и квесты, просто выполнив главный сюжетный квест, и всё это с учётом того, что в игры подобного жанра я ранее не играл). Подытожим данный обзор: игра показалось мне интересной, в ней достаточно весело, но не обольщайтесь, ведь её хватает только на 10 часов, дальше вы просто сталкиваетесь со скукой, легкими монстрами, большими пустыми расстояниями, скучными квестами, награда за которые не стоит для вас и минуты вашего времени. Если после этого вы всё таки добьёте основной квест пропустив множество локаций и посредственных квестов, то получите ещё каплю удовольствия насладившись финальными 30 минутами геймплея, которые служат своеобразным босс-файтом. В любом случае если вы пройдете мимо данной игры, то я уверен, ничего не потеряете.

Seriously one of my favourite games of all time, though. Main Story is kinda wacky but fun to play nonetheless.

If you don't mind euro-jank RPGs, you'll feel right at home here.  Lush environments, interesting loot, amazing soundtrack, terrible voice acting, and wonky animations.  Better than Gothic 3? Without a doubt, yes.  Better than Oblivion?  Hell no.  3/5 kiras.
В целом, хорошая игра, для своего времени, но игре очень не хватает респауна врагов, ибо бегать по пустому миру не очень классно.

Is it bugged? Yes.
Bad voice acting? Yes.
Is it fun? Yes.
Recommended.

Here is my review after a few hours of trying this game. I thought many of the aspects of this RPG looked very interesting from the beginning onward. But I was stopped by the fact that horses are so buggy that they glitched about everywhere and you spend most of that time just walking; because walking is easier than using their horse which steers extremely slow. Also, I thought the interface lacked proper action bars, which can normally simply be managed by clicking/dragging items/spells/skills unto the action bar. Two-worlds did not have that function =\ When I see a game having these issues, I see neglect. So I am left concluding that I have better games to play with my time. Gamers play for fun, I play for fun, who doesn't?

Ein prächtiges RPG mit großartiger deutscher Synchro. Definitve Kaufempfehlung!

Step 1 - Build a warrior type character

Step 2 - Explore and quest

Step 3 - Come across a quest to steal a jewel that is protecting a town from orc invasion

Step 4 - Realize that you actually killed off the entire town by stealing said jewel

Step 5 - Respec my character completely into a mage

Step 6 - Get a resurrection spell

Step 7- Go back to now ghost town and resurrect everyone, including orcs that died in the battle

Step 8 - Now enjoy a town full of quest givers, shop keepers, and general NPC's sweeping the street with their now orc friends.

I have never played another game where this scenario is possible.  For the resurrection spell alone, I recommend this game.
Playing this game is like eating canned soup from a nonprofit food organization.
Animasyonları bi garip yinede idare eder.

Bought this back in 2014 but didn't play much; can't remember why though. Could be any number of reasons; other games to play or maybe it was underperforming. 5 years later i heard a nice piece of music titled Two Worlds and wondered if it's in the game. Of course that would mean playing the game in its entirety or buy the soundtrack.

So here we are, i fired-up the game and lo & behold there was quite a bit of stuttering. Looking at the reviews it seems that i'm not alone but i was determined to get to the bottom of it since it's an old game and the system requirements is not high regarding the GPU.

[b][i]So here's the deal; if you plan to record the gameplay and you're using AMD GPU, don't use the GPU driver System Metrics overlay and use MSI Afterburner to monitor instead and the stuttering would vanish nearly completely. You can still use ReLive to record. If not then disregard the previous 2 sentences.[/i][/b]

[h1]Preliminary Observations[/h1]
Cutscenes character animations not realistic - walking animation too slow IMO.

Voice acting is ok i guess. 

Pretty good graphics for an old game - good lighting and shadow effects.

Disappointed that there is no achievements to mark progress but hey it's inexpensive.

Here is the intro cutscenes and some gameplay. As you can see the fps is fairly constant at 60.
https://youtu.be/lSm2oXpFf7A

Gameplay 7/10
Music 8/10
Graphics quality 6.5/10
Voice acting 6/10
Story - dunno yet nothing profound so far


Overall yes recommended even if only for the music.

[h1]Update 1 - May 24th 2019 0230 hrs [/h1]
[strike]My bad; it seems quite certain now that performance is nearly identical whether AMD driver Metrics overlay or MSI Afterburner is used for system monitoring.[/strike] It was something i overlooked; there were other programs running in the background that caused the noticeable stuttering and frame rate dips. Exiting these programs improved performance for the intro but when the gameplay scene is in the village, there are fluctuations in the frame rate. The only difference is that the AMD metrics couldn't stay put in full-screen mode nor work properly in windowed mode but the MSI Afterburner works without any problems. This issue isn't due to the game as it's the same in many games.

Anyway i have to add 2 more scores for performance and stabillity:
[strike]GPU optimization - 5.5/10 (unstable fps in populated areas)[/strike]
[strike]Stability - 4/10 (Crashes to desktop when changing graphic options if any kind of hardware monitoring is on)[/strike]

[h1]Update 2 - May 24th 2019 1723 hrs[/h1]
Disregard the first sentence of Update 1. My initial assessment is correct; the game does lag and stutter badly when AMD Metrics overlay is used while game is being recorded. Using MSI Afterburner alleviate this performance hit. However this causes a crash to desktop if you change the game's video resolution.

There's more stability when using all AMD's solution but at the expense of performance. Using Afterburner to monitor and AMD driver to record gives best performance at the expense of stability. Using MSI solution for both recording and monitoring however is the worst, neither performance nor stability gain.

I finally managed to get relatively stable performance between 50-60 fps averaging somewhere at 59 fps most of the time. Found out that 2 settings degrade performance significantly regardless of what resolution or other graphics options; HDR and Anti-aliasing. So those 2 is completely off.

[b]GPU optimization - 7/10 - Not fully efficient performance with AMD driver
Stability - 5/10 (Crashes to desktop when changing resolution if MSI Afterburner is on)
Story - Typical feudal war coupled with a personal story of the protagonist.[/b]

[h1]Final Update - May 24th 2019 1813hrs[/h1]
I give-up; this game's performance perplexed me. One moment it's fine the next, fps fluctuates down to 40s range. No matter what i do it just keeps changing. There's no such thing as frame rate stability in this game, at least not for me.

Still recommended though as there is a lot of depth; armor, weapons, potions, ingredients, crafting and magic. You can be a knight, mage, thief or anything in between; there is no set class.

[b]Overall 7/10 - Unstable frame rate.[/b]
